config_element.name: PioStatus
config_element.label: Read the status of the PIO lines
config_element.description_user:
This key returns the state of the chip PIO lines 0 to 79 as a bitmask.
This key returns 10 octets comprising of 5 16-bit bitmasks where bit 0 of the i'th bitmask represents PIO[0+16*i],bit 1 represents PIO[1+16*i], and so on. Here bit 0 is the least significant bit of a word.
So for example, if PIOs 0, 1, 13, 14 and 50 were high and all other PIOs were low the MIB value is: - [0x6003 0x0 0x0 0x0004 0x0] in uint16 format - [0x60 0x03 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x04 0x0 0x0] in octet format

config_element.name: PioProtectMask
config_element.label: Read which PIOs are reserved by the on-chip firmware
config_element.description_user:
This key allows the host to see which PIOs are reserved by the on-chip firmware.
It is read-only.
This key holds 5 16-bit bitmasks, refer to PioStatus for the format of mapping PIOs to these bitmasks.
If the bit corresponding to a PIO is high, it has been reserved by the on-chip firmware. This is likely to be a consequence of setting another MIB key to specify this PIO as being used in the feature controlled by that MIB key.
If a PIO is allocated to the chip, the host may not attempt to modify it.

config_element.name: ResourceDependencies
config_element.label: Array of pairs of resource identifiers specifying dependencies
config_element.description_user:
The string consists of an arbitrary number of sets of four octets. Each set encodes two unsigned 16-bit numbers, with the more significant octet first within each number. These pairs of numbers correspond to hardware resources (type CCP_RESOURCE_ID). Each pair specifies that the first resource depends on the second resource, ie whenever the first resource is requested, the second resource must first be acquired.
Both resources must be known to the firmware, ie must be compiled into the resource database. Not all resources are necessarily known to all versions of the chip management subsystem firmware.
This is used to specify run-time dependency information for resources. For example, to specify that a certain piece of hardware (CCP_RESOURCE_ID_WONDAWARE) depends on PIOs 3 and 4, the string would contain the four resource IDs: CCP_RESOURCE_ID_WONDAWARE CCP_RESOURCE_ID_PIO3 CCP_RESOURCE_ID_WONDAWARE CCP_RESOURCE_ID_PIO4
Failure to write this key, for example because there was not enough memory to store the dependency information or because one of the resource identifiers was not present in the firmware, causes the dependency information to be empty.

config_element.name: DeepSleepPioWake
config_element.label: Mask of PIOs that wake the chip from deep sleep
config_element.description_user:
Array of five 16-bit masks of PIOs that wake the chip from deep sleep.
Refer to PioStatus for the format of mapping PIOs to these bitmasks.
No arrangements are made for the chip to remain awake, so this is only useful when combined with additional signalling.
By default, the PIO is assumed to be active high. This can be changed with the MIB attribute DeepSleepPioInvert.

config_element.name: DeepSleepPioInvert
config_element.label: Mask of PIOs that wake the chip from deep sleep when low
config_element.description_user:
Array of five 16-bit masks of PIOs that wake the chip from deep sleep when low. Refer to PioStatus for the format of mapping PIOs to these bitmasks.
- If the corresponding bit in DeepSleepPioWake is 0, the bit is ignored.
- Otherwise, if the bit is 0, the PIO causes wake from deep sleep when high.
- Otherwise, if the bit is 1, the PIO causes wake from deep sleep when low.

config_element.name: USBManufString
config_element.label: USB Manufacturer string descriptor
config_element.description_user: Manufacturer string descriptor for the USB debugger and the Hub devices

config_element.name: USBVendorID
config_element.label: USB Vendor ID code
config_element.description_user: USB Vendor ID for both the hub and the USB debugger device

config_element.name: USBHubProductString
config_element.label: USB product string descriptor for hub
config_element.description_user: USB hub product string descriptor

config_element.name: USBHubSerialNumberString
config_element.label: USB serial number string descriptor for hub
config_element.description_user: USB hub serial number string descriptor

config_element.name: USBHubConfigString
config_element.label: USB configuration string descriptor for hub
config_element.description_user: USB hub configuration string descriptor for the hub's single configuration

config_element.name: USBHubProductID
config_element.label: USB hub product ID
config_element.description_user: Product ID of the Curator Hub device.

config_element.name: USBHubMaxPower
config_element.label: Maximum power drawn by the hub when acting as a bus-powered device
config_element.description_user:
Specify the maximum power drawn by the device if it is bus-powered. Expressed in units of 2mA. (See USB2.0 standard, table 9-10.)
If USBSelfPowered is TRUE, this value is ignored and the device declares that it draws no current.

config_element.name: USBSelfPowered
config_element.label: Indicates whether the chip draws power from the USB or not
config_element.description_user: This can be set to TRUE if the chip has a separate power source. The value of USBHubMaxPower is ignored when this is TRUE - it is overridden to 0.

config_element.name: SqifAudioMaskROM
config_element.label: Execute Audio from serial flash instead of ROM
config_element.description_user: If true, the Audio subsystem will be configured to run from an external serial flash. The chip will panic if no suitable serial flash is detected at boot-time. If False chip will ignore any attached serial flash and boot the subsystem from ROM.

config_element.name: DeepSleepBypassLDOHP
config_element.label: Determine whether to leave the bypass LDO in high power during deep sleep.
config_element.description_user:
For some applications we may need the bypass LDO to power external devices in which case it may need to remain in high power mode during deep sleep. This key allows HP mode to be forced during deep sleep
The key DormantBypassLDOHP gives the equivalent control during dormant.
Note the voltage of this supply can also vary during operation. See the key BypassLdoForce3v3 for details.

config_element.name: QSPIModeOverrides
config_element.label: Array of (key,value) pairs indicating mode overrides for QSPI flash interfaces
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: DCDTimeout
config_element.label: Set the number of milliseconds used for the data contact detect timeout.
config_element.description_user:
When the USB cable is plugged in there is a delay between the VBUS line connecting and the data lines connecting. A timeout is used to state the max time between these two events. When the timeout occurs the firmware will assume the data lines have made contact.
If VBUS is present on VCHG when the chip boots the boot time will be subtracted from DCDTimeout to ensure we still wait for the requested time. If the boot time is greater than the requested DCDTimeout a FAULT_BOOT_TIME_GREATER_THAN_DCD_TIMEOUT will be generated.

config_element.name: AppsProcsClkRate
config_element.label: Defines the clock rate of both the Apps processors.
config_element.description_user: Key values: 0 : use SCALED clock 1 : use PLL clock (80MHz) Other values reserved. NOTE: Not all products can select all clock rates.

config_element.name: ChargerIsUSB
config_element.label: Set whether the charger is USB or not
config_element.description_user: When true, when a charger is plugged in USB charger detection will take place to find out what type of USB charger is connected. When false, if a charger is plugged in Curator will assume it's a non-USB charger.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTBaseParams
config_element.label: The basic identifiers and parameters for the QSPIF RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTSPIReadParams
config_element.label: The SPI mode read parameters for RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTSPIConfVector
config_element.label: The SPI mode configuration vector for RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTFastReadParams
config_element.label: The fast mode read parameters for RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTFastConfVector
config_element.label: The fast mode configuration vector for RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTWriteCmds
config_element.label: The write command parameters for QSPI flash RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTStatusReadParams
config_element.label: The status register parameters for the QSPI flash RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTStatusReadVector
config_element.label: The command vectors to read status registers for RAM LUT QSPI flash chips.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTDPDCmds
config_element.label: The Deep Power Down commands for RAM LUT QSPI flash chips.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTResetVector
config_element.label: The vector to reset RAM LUT QSPI flash chips.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: SqifEnableChipSelect1
config_element.label: Enable the QSPI RAM Chip Select line on relevant interfaces.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for QSPI RAM devices.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which QSPI RAM devices can be used and how to use this key to configure them.

config_element.name: EnableAudioSqif
config_element.label: Enable the Audio QSPI interface when Audio is running from ROM.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for QSPI RAM devices.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which QSPI RAM devices can be used and how to use this key to configure them.

config_element.name: MclkPLLAlphaVcoConfig
config_element.label: VCO configuration for MCLK PLL.
config_element.description_user: Advanced settings for VCO in the MCLK PLL. SET ONLY ON ADVICE FROM QUALCOMM

config_element.name: MclkPLLCoarseDacConfig
config_element.label: Coarse DAC configuration for the MCLK PLL.
config_element.description_user: Advanced settings for the coarse DAC in the MCLK PLL. SET ONLY ON ADVICE FROM QUALCOMM

config_element.name: BypassLdoForce3v3
config_element.label: Force bypass LDO output to 3v3.
config_element.description_user:
When running from battery, by default, the bypass LDO output voltage is lowered from 3v3 to save power. When this key is set the bypass LDO output is forced to 3v3 volts. This can be particularly useful for the scenario where peripherals which require 3v3 are powered by the bypass LDO.
Note on some chips the bypass LDO must be lowered whilst programming efuse bits. Seek guidance if 3v3 is required and efuse bits are to be programmed.
Note also the Bypass LDO may be put into a low power mode during deep sleep and dormant. The keys DeepSleepBypassLDOHP and DormantBypassLDOHP can be used to prevent this.

config_element.name: QSPICalOverrides
config_element.label: Array of 15 octets representing the interval boundaries for the pad calibration overrides
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: ChargerInsertionDebounceTime
config_element.label: Debounce time for charger insertion in milliseconds.
config_element.description_user: This is a simple delay when VCHG goes high, it happens before USB charger detection. If ChargerIsUSB is false then this is the only debouncing, if it is true then the USB charger detection includes additional USB debouncing.

config_element.name: ChargerRemovalDebounceTime
config_element.label: Debounce time for charger removal in milliseconds.
config_element.description_user: This is a simple delay when VCHG goes low. It provides the only debouncing on charger removal, regardless of the value of ChargerIsUSB.

config_element.name: USBHubDeviceRemovable
config_element.label: Value for the DeviceRemovable field of the USB hub class descriptor
config_element.description_user: USB2.0 standard, section 11.23.2.1 "Hub Descriptor", offset 7 "DeviceRemovable". Bit 0 is reserved (0), bit 1 corresponds to port 1, bit 2 to port 2, bit 3 to port 3 and bit 4 to port 4. Each bit can be either 0 - device is removable or 1 - device is non-removable. Default value makes all 4 internal devices non-removable.

config_element.name: SqifClockControl
config_element.label: Defines the default clock source for SQIF Interface 0 and SQIF Interface 1
config_element.description_user:
This MIB uses two nibbles to set the SQIF clocks as follows: Bits 3:0 - define the SQIF Interface 0 clock source selection. Bits 7:4 - define the SQIF Interface 1 clock source selection.
SQIF interface 0: Audio SQIF interface 1: Apps
Values for each SQIF clock nibble are: 0 - XTAL clock source (32MHz) 1 - PLL clock source (80MHz) Others - reserved

config_element.name: USBChargerDetectDCDThreshold
config_element.label: Voltage threshold in mV for data contact detection
config_element.description_user: The voltage threshold in mV on D+ during data contact detection that we use to determine if the charger is present or not. If the D+ voltage is less than this threshold we deduce the charger is present.

config_element.name: USBChargerDetectProprietaryThreshold
config_element.label: Voltage threshold in mV for proprietary charger detection
config_element.description_user: The voltage threshold in mV on D- just after primary detection that we use to determine if the charger is proprietary or not. If the D- voltage is greater than this threshold we deduce the charger is proprietary.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUT4BAMCmds
config_element.label: The 4 Byte Address Mode commands for RAM LUT QSPI flash chips.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTSuspendResumeCmds
config_element.label: The suspend/resume commands for RAM LUT QSPI flash chips.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIFRAMLUTEraseParams
config_element.label: The erase parameters for QSPI flash RAM LUT entries.
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for Flash devices not supported in the curator ROM.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which other Flash devices can be used and how to use these keys to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIAudioPadSet
config_element.label: The QSPI pad set to be used by the Audio subsystem
config_element.description_user: This key is used to determine which set of QSPI pads the Audio subsystem will use when it is configured to use them.

config_element.name: QSPIRAMParams
config_element.label: Parameters used for QSPI RAM configuration
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for QSPI RAM devices.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which QSPI RAM devices can be used and how to use this key to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIRAMConfigVector
config_element.label: QSPI RAM configuration vector
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for QSPI RAM devices.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which QSPI RAM devices can be used and how to use this key to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIRAMResetVector
config_element.label: QSPI RAM reset vector
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for QSPI RAM devices.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which QSPI RAM devices can be used and how to use this key to configure them.

config_element.name: QSPIRAMPIOConfigAudio
config_element.label: QSPI RAM PIO power control configuration for the Audio subsystem
config_element.description_user:
This key is used to configure support for QSPI RAM devices.
Seek guidance from Qualcomm on which QSPI RAM devices can be used and how to use this key to configure them.

config_element.name: PanicOnFault
config_element.label: Halt the system on any fault
config_element.description_user:
When the chip's firmware detects a problem that implies that it cannot continue operation (for example, running out of pool memory) it normally calls panic(). This halts the firmware, and may reboot it. By contrast, when the chip's firmware encounters a problem that it can survive (for example, detecting a received corrupt packet) it normally calls fault(), which can cause a fault report message to be created.
If this MIB entry is set to TRUE, the firmware calls panic() when it would normally call fault().
Only set this for system debugging.
See PanicOnFaultExceptions, which sets exceptions to PanicOnFault.

config_element.name: PanicOnFaultExceptions
config_element.label: List of fault ids treated the opposite to PanicOnFault
config_element.description_user:
An array of eight octets giving a list of four 16-bit fault ids. Each 16-bit fault id will be treated the opposite to PanicOnFault (see below). Fault ids not required must be set to 0000 ie FAULT_NONE or "not a fault". If this MIB key is not set curator behaves as if it were [0000 0000 0000 0000].
If PanicOnFault is true this is a whitelist ie all faults cause a panic except for the fault ids in this list.
If PanicOnFault is false this is a blacklist ie only the fault ids in this list cause a panic.
Only set this for system debugging.

config_element.name: CuratorDeepSleepConfig
config_element.label: Deep sleep mode choice
config_element.description_user:
There are the following possible approaches to deep sleep.
0: Do not do it.
1: Do it whenever possible.
Other values are reserved

config_element.name: VCHGMessageEnable
config_element.label: Control whether 2-wire VCHG communication is enabled
config_element.description_user:
Enables 2-wire VCHG communication. If set to false, no attempt is made to process any incoming VCHG messages and any requests to send VCHG messages will be ignored.
Seek advice from Qualcomm before using this key.

config_element.name: VCHGMessageEarbud
config_element.label: Select which earbud this device represents
config_element.description_user:
Select which earbud this device represents in the context of VCHG charger comms.
The device will only accept messages that are addressed to it, the options are: 0 - Ignore all messages 1 - Right earbud 2 - Left earbud
This is only applicable when 2-wire VCHG communication is enabled with VCHGMessageEnable.

config_element.name: DSULPTimeConversionFactor
config_element.label: ULP slow cycles to microseconds correction factor
config_element.description_user:
When using the crystal in Ultra Low Power mode as the deep sleep timer source, this key allows any consistent offset in the crystal frequency that occurs in this mode only to be compensated for. Seek advice from Qualcomm before using this key.
This patch changes the default value of the key to: 122

config_element.name: ChargerAdjustVfloatTrim
config_element.label: Adjust the charger float voltage trim
config_element.description_user:
The initial trim setting of the charger float voltage is set during production. This MIB key will add the specified signed offset to that value.
The default value of this setting is zero.
Seek advice from Qualcomm before using this key.

config_element.name: SystemResourceNonDependencies
config_element.label: Array of pairs of resource identifiers specifying system dependencies to be removed
config_element.description_user: This key has an identical format to ResourceDependencies. It is used to specify dependencies at the system level which are compiled into the system, but are to be ignored at run time. In each pair of resource identifiers, the resource given by the first identifier no longer depends on the resource given by the second. No error is reported if the first identifier did not previously depend on the second (though clearly this setting is not useful). A pair of values within the array also overrides any corresponding dependency set in other MIB keys.

config_element.name: UartPinsConfig
config_element.label: PIO configuration needed for UART pins
config_element.description_user:
The value is an octet string consisting of four octets, each describing one of the four UART pins, in the order RTS, CTS, data TX, data RX. The format is strict. An invalid format causes the firmware to panic.
Each octet can have one of the following values:
0-0x7f: Use this value as the PIO for this UART pin. Note that valid values are constrained by packages and modules as well as chip hardware. The resource for the configured PIO will be acquired with the UART_WITH_PIOS resource and the hardware will be configured appropriately.
0x80: Do not connect this pin. The UART hardware will be set to an unused PIO for this function. The PIO will not be routed to pins, however care needs to be taken if several pins are disabled as they will all use the same default unused pin and so may interact. To prevent this the controlling subsystem should separately set the CTS pin to be ignored and the RTS to drive a zero if they are not required.
If the configured PIO requires additional resources, such as configuration of voltage level at the pad, these are handled automatically. Note that in such cases if a voltage level was previously configured, for example as a resource dependency during subsystem boot, it is assumed to be suitable. Otherwise, VDD_PADS is used.

config_element.name: DeepSleepVoltageReduction
config_element.label: Voltage reduction when chip is in deep sleep
config_element.description_user:
Adjust the voltage to be used in deep sleep
SET ONLY ON ADVICE FROM QUALCOMM

config_element.name: XtalLoadCapacitance
config_element.label: The capacitance for driving a crystal providing the raw clock
config_element.description_user: If the chip's fast clock is provided by a crystal, this value is used to set the coarse capacitive load. It is configured for each module design separately. The overall load capacitance requires tuning the coarse and fine trim controls. Also refers to the mib XtalFreqTrim which defines the fine load capacitance.

config_element.name: XtalFreqTrim
config_element.label: Fine frequency trim for a crystal providing the raw chip clock
config_element.description_user: If the chip's fast clock is provided by a crystal, this value is used as a fine trim for the crystal frequency. It may be set for each individual chip to compensate for process variations. The overall load capacitance is defined by the coarse and fine trim. Also refers to the mib XtalLoadCapacitance which defines the coarse load capacitance.

config_element.name: PioDirectionElements
config_element.label: Set whether individual PIOs are input or output
config_element.description_user:
The chip's PIO lines can be configured as either Input IOs or Output IOs. This key sets the direction of individual PIOs or set of PIOs when they are used as the standard IOs. The value is an array of pairs of octets. The first octet in each pair is the number of a PIO, currently from 0 to 79 . The second octet is 0 to set the PIO to input, 1 to set it to output. The maximum PIOs can be configured by this mib are 64 PIOs. If there are more than 64 PIOs to be configured, they should be defined by two of this mib keys and included separately by two different configuration files.
The key cannot be read.

config_element.name: PioDriveElements
config_element.label: Set whether individual PIOs are high or low
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the logical level of the individual PIOs or set of PIOs when those PIOs are configured as the output IO. The value is an array of pairs of octets. The first octet in each pair is the number of a PIO, currently from 0 to 79 . The second octet is 0 to set the PIO low, or 1 to set the PIO high. The maximum PIOs can be configured by this mib are 64 PIOs. If there are more than 64 PIOs to be configured, they should be defined by two of this mib keys and included separately by two different configuration files. This key cannot be read.

config_element.name: PioSubsystemAllocationElements
config_element.label: Set the subsystem owner for individual PIOs
config_element.description_user:
This key specifies the bus address of the subsystem that will own the PIO for individual PIOs or set of PIOs. The value of this key is an array of pairs of octets. The first octet in each pair is the number of a PIO, currently from 0 to 79 . The second octet is the bus address of the subsystem to which the PIO is to be allocated.
Note this key controls the initial configuration of PIOs. But this configuration can be altered later via the P1 trap API or by the configuration of external components or interfaces.
The maximum PIOs can be configured by this mib are 64 PIOs. If there are more than 64 PIOs to be configured, they should be defined by two of this mib keys and included separately by two different configuration files.
This key cannot be read.

config_element.name: CuratorTemperatureMultiplier
config_element.label: Multiplicative factor for curator temperature measurement.
config_element.description_user:
This value is used to multiply the raw temperature reading derived from the hardware in the chip's AUX or PMU macro to give a value where differences between readings are in degrees Celsius. The value CuratorTemperatureAddition is added to the result to convert to degrees Celsius.
This value is a signed 32-bit integer in two's complement representation. It represents a fixed point number found by shifting right by 16 bits. Hence the top 16 bits of the number stored in the MIB represent the integer part of the resulting number while the lower 16 bits a fractional part. For example, 0x000A0000 represents the integer 10 and 0xFFFFC000 represents -1/4.
This key must be set for temperature compensation to be performed.

config_element.name: CuratorTemperatureAddition
config_element.label: Additive constant for the curator temperature measurement.
config_element.description_user:
This value is added to the result of using the MIB attribute CuratorTemperatureMultiplier to give a temperature in degrees Celsius from the chip's AUX or PMU macro.
The value is 16-bit signed integer: there is no fractional part as the temperature accuracy is not expected to be better than one degree Celsius.
The default value given is a good starting point, but if accurate temperature measurements are required this value must be calibrated.

config_element.name: XtalDutyCycle
config_element.label: The crystal duty cycle setting.
config_element.description_user:
If the chip's fast clock is provided by a crystal, this value is used to set the duty cycle. It is calibrated on the production line.
The value is an unsigned integer in the range 0 .. 31 inclusive

config_element.name: USBDebugger
config_element.label: USB Debugger Enable
config_element.description_user: Set to false to disable USB debugger.

config_element.name: DormantModeEnable
config_element.label: Enable Dormant mode functionality
config_element.description_user:
When set to true, allows the chip to enter the ultra-low power dormant mode when requested by Apps 0 . In this mode, all digital and analogue supplies are switched off. Only the KeepAlive (KA) power domain, the VHV and BYP_LDO are active. The BYP_LDO and VHV can also be individually put into their respective ULP modes by configuring the DormantBypassLDOHP and DormantVHVLDOHP MIBs respectively. Wake up from dormant can occur on a timer event, LED, SYS_CTRL and/or charger insertion based on the wake-up config received from the Apps 0 . SYS_CTRL and VCHG wakes are always enabled by default during dormant. The rest can be requested by the Apps 0 .
Wake ups on NFC, XIOs and some PIOs are also possible on some chips.

config_element.name: OffModeEnable
config_element.label: Enable Off mode functionality
config_element.description_user: When set to true, allows the chip to enter OFF state when requested by Apps 0 . In the OFF state, the chip is completely de-powered except for some analogue circuitry in the PMU to assist in wake from OFF state. The only sources that can cause a wake up from OFF state are SYS_CTRL and charger insertion.

config_element.name: DormantBypassLDOHP
config_element.label: Determine whether to leave the bypass LDO in high power during dormant.
config_element.description_user:
For some applications we may need the bypass LDO to power external devices in which case it may need to remain in high power mode during dormant. This key allows HP mode to be forced during dormant.
The key DeepSleepBypassLDOHP gives the equivalent control during deep sleep.
Note the voltage of this supply can also vary during operation. See the key BypassLdoForce3v3 for details.

config_element.name: DormantVHVLDOHP
config_element.label: Determine whether to leave the 1v8 VHV LDO in high power during dormant.
config_element.description_user: For some applications we may need the VHV LDO to provide power to external/internal 1v8 devices, in which case it will need to remain in high power mode during dormant.

config_element.name: PMUForcePWM
config_element.label: Force the PMU to use PWM at all times other than deep sleep
config_element.description_user: This allows a config file to set the system to use the PMU PWM at all times when active. This applies to both the PA and core SMPSs.

config_element.name: PioPadControlElements
config_element.label: Set the pad control for individual PIOs
config_element.description_user:
This key sets the pad control for individual PIOs. The value is an array of pairs of octets. The first octet in each pair is the number of a PIO, currently from 0 to 79 . The second octet is the pad control setting, which is specific to each PIO. For example, for LED IOs only the Pull Enable is configurable.
The bit field definition of pad control setting are: - bits 0-1: Drive strength - bit 2: UNUSED - set to 0 - bit 3: Pull enable - bit 4: Pull strength - bit 5: Pull direction - bit 6: Sticky enable
Note this key controls the initial configuration of PIOs. But this configuration can be altered later via the P1 trap API or by the configuration of external components or interfaces.
The maximum PIOs that can be configured by this mib are 64 PIOs. If there are more than 64 PIOs to be configured, they should be defined by two of this mib keys and included separately by two different configuration files.
The key cannot be read.
The pad control values for PIOs which are used for APP 0 QSPI Flash are defined as the default value here.

config_element.name: UseAccurateSOSC
config_element.label: Use SOSC rather than the XTAL in ULP mode for deep sleep timing
config_element.description_user:
This key allows an internal Slow Oscillator (SOSC) to be used for deep sleep timing when 250ppm timing accuracy is required, rather than Ultra Low Power (ULP) mode for the crystal. Temperature correction mechanisms for the SOSC are used to allow it to maintain the required timing accuracy.
This allows a lower deep sleep current at the required accuracy for bluetooth.
True means use the SOSC, False means use the crystal.

config_element.name: PMUSMPS32MWaveForm
config_element.label: A value to set the SMPS mark/space ratio in PWM when using the 32MHz clock
config_element.description_user:
Generally the default 8:8 mark/space ratio giving a 2MHz clock for SMPSs in PWM is sufficient. However, there is a possibility it could interfere with other clocks, so this MIB key allows the user to override the default to achieve different mark/space ratios
The value is programmed into a register containing two six bit fields, in bits 0-5 and 6-11. These are respectively the high and low period, but offset by 1 (so 0 means 1 etc).
The default value corresponds to low=7,high=7, which gives an 8:8 mark/space ratio and a 2MHz switching frequency.
This setting should be use with care, as tinkering with the SMPSs can produce unexpected results.
Note this MIB key is only useful when we've selected 32MHz as the clock source in the SmpsPwmClockSourceControl MIB. When 80MHz is selected as the source use PMUSMPS80MWaveForm instead.

config_element.name: XtalCalibrationParameters
config_element.label: Parameters used for XTAL calibration
config_element.description_user:
An array of ten octets defined as follows: Octets 0-2 - ULP mode Min Bias, Max Bias and Target Threshold resp. Octets 3-5 - LP mode Min Bias, Max Bias and Target Threshold resp. Octets 6-8 - LN mode Min Bias, Max Bias and Target Threshold resp. Octet 9 - Bit 0 - Increment bias after below Target Threshold reached. Octet 9 - Bits 7:1 - Reserved.
This patch changes the default value of the key to: [0a 0a 00 0f 0f 00 0a 0a 00 01]

config_element.name: PanicAction
config_element.label: Action to take when a panic or subsystem watchdog occurs
config_element.description_user:
0: Immediately reset the device (default). This setting should be used for the final production image to ensure if a subsystem panics then the device will automatically reset.
1: Halt all subsystems including Curator and Janitor, no USB debug access. This setting should be used during development. It stops all subsystems and allows core dumps to be taken over TRB for analysis.
2: Halt all subsystems except Curator and Janitor, keeping USB debug access. This setting should be used for development without TRB, allowing core dumps to be taken over USB for analysis.
This is held in the preserved block so its value persists across a software reboot until MIB keys are loaded during boot. If no value is specified then it will take the default value of 0 at that point. On a hardware reboot or power on reset it will get value 0 when the preserved block is zeroed.
If the debugger is present for the subsystem panicking or watchdogging (SS bit set by tool_cmd debugger_set_debugger_present_req) then the value of PanicAction is ignored and the behaviour for value 2 occurs instead.

config_element.name: LpxxLpxBiasTrimSettings
config_element.label: OSC_ULP_BIAS Trim settings to use with LPX or LPXX XTAL modes
config_element.description_user:
Bits 07:00 Bias setting for LPX Mode Bits 15:08 Bias setting for LPXX Mode Note that a value of zero will leave the respective setting as per the calibrated LP bias value.
This patch changes the default value of the key to: 0x1414

config_element.name: VCHGPullEnable
config_element.label: Enable the VCHG pull down resistor.
config_element.description_user:
Enable or disable the pull-down on the VCHG pin when VCHG is not present.
If true, the pull-down is enabled except when VCHG > 3.6V. If false, the pull-down will be permanently disabled.

config_element.name: ExternalChargerTrimAdjustment
config_element.label: MIB key to adjust the external charger trim
config_element.description_user:
MIB key to adjust the trim used for battery charging in "external" mode.
SET ONLY ON ADVICE FROM QUALCOMM
